required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Study Comparing Xalacom And Xalatan In Patients With Primary Open Angle Glaucoma (POAG) Or Ocular Hypertension (OH).
clinical_study.official_title: A 8-Week, Randomized, Double-Masked, Parallel Group, Phase III Study Comparing The Efficacy And Safety Of Xalacom And Xalatan In Patients With Primary Open Angle Glaucoma (POAG) Or Ocular Hypertension (OH).

brief_summary.textblock: This study will examine the efficacy and safety of Xalacom comparing with those of Xalatan in Japanese patients with POAG or OH.

primary_outcome.measure: Change of Intraocular Pressure (IOP) From Baseline to Week 8

secondary_outcome.measure: Change of IOP From Baseline to Week 4
Percent Change of IOP From Baseline to Week 8
Number of Subjects With an IOP of <=15 mmHg at Week 8
Number of Subjects With an IOP of <=16 mmHg at Week 8
Number of Subjects With an IOP of <=17 mmHg at Week 8
Number of Subjects With an IOP of <=18 mmHg at Week 8
Number of Subjects With an IOP Reduction of >=2 mmHg From Baseline to Week 8
Number of Subjects With an IOP Reduction of >=3 mmHg From Baseline to Week 8

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Intraocular pressure is 18 mmHg or more at baseline after treatment with Xalatan for 4 weeks or more.
Exclusion Criteria:
- History of no-response to timolol
- History of trabeculectomy
- History of other ocular surgery including ALT, SLT,and trabeculotomy within 6 months

link.description: To obtain contact information for a study center near you, click here.

participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: 300 subjects were treated with Xalatan in Run-in period. (Run-in period: subjects treated with Xalatan (0.005% latanoprost eye drop), one drop, once daily in the evening (20:00-23:00).) Of these, 289 subjects were assigned to groups (144 in KP2035 group and 145 in Xalatan group).

group.title: KP2035 Group
group.description: Subjects were treated with KP2035 (0.005% latanoprost + 0.5% timolol combination eye drop) one drop, once daily in the evening (20:00-23:00).

group.title: Xalatan Group
group.description: Subjects were treated with Xalatan (0.005% latanoprost), one drop, once daily in the evening (20:00-23:00).

group.title: KP2035 Group
group.description: Subjects were treated with KP2035 (0.005% latanoprost + 0.5% timolol combination eye drop) one drop, once daily in the evening (20:00-23:00).

group.title: Xalatan Group
group.description: Subjects were treated with Xalatan (0.005% latanoprost), one drop, once daily in the evening (20:00-23:00).

group.title: Total
group.description: Total of all reporting groups

outcome.title: Change of Intraocular Pressure (IOP) From Baseline to Week 8
outcome.description: Value at Week 8 minus value at baseline
outcome.population: The primary efficacy analysis population was the Intent-to-treat population (ITT) which consisted of all subjects treated with the study drug as randomized. If there were any missing IOP values at Week 8, the data were supplemented by LOCF (Last Observation Carried Forward) using data at Week 4.

group.title: KP2035 Group
group.description: Subjects were treated with KP2035 (0.005% latanoprost + 0.5% timolol combination eye drop) one drop, once daily in the evening (20:00-23:00).

group.title: Xalatan Group
group.description: Subjects were treated with Xalatan (0.005% latanoprost), one drop, once daily in the evening (20:00-23:00).

measure.title: Change of Intraocular Pressure (IOP) From Baseline to Week 8
measure.description: Value at Week 8 minus value at baseline
measure.population: The primary efficacy analysis population was the Intent-to-treat population (ITT) which consisted of all subjects treated with the study drug as randomized. If there were any missing IOP values at Week 8, the data were supplemented by LOCF (Last Observation Carried Forward) using data at Week 4.

analysis.groups_desc: The sample size of 132 subjects per group would be needed to detect the 1.5 mmHg treatment difference with 3.75 mmHg of the standard deviation at a power of 90% in two-sided t tests with a 0.05 level of confidence. One hundred and forty six subjects per group (total of 292) were planned to allow for drop outs and withdrawals.
analysis.p_value_desc: The level of statistical significance was the two-sided 0.05. Primary as well as secondary endpoints were tested, but because the tests of the secondary endpoints are exploratory, no adjustment to p-values was made for multiple comparisons.
analysis.method_desc: Analysis of covariance (ANCOVA) was applied using the treatment groups as a factor and baseline IOP of the study eyes as a covariate.
analysis.estimate_desc: Mean difference was calculated as "mean change from baseline to Week 8 in KP2035 group" minus "mean change from baseline to Week 8 in Xalatan group".

outcome.title: Change of IOP From Baseline to Week 4
outcome.description: Value at Week 4 minus value at baseline

group.title: KP2035 Group
group.description: Subjects were treated with KP2035 (0.005% latanoprost + 0.5% timolol combination eye drop) one drop, once daily in the evening (20:00-23:00).

group.title: Xalatan Group
group.description: Subjects were treated with Xalatan (0.005% latanoprost), one drop, once daily in the evening (20:00-23:00).

measure.title: Change of IOP From Baseline to Week 4
measure.description: Value at Week 4 minus value at baseline

analysis.p_value_desc: The level of statistical significance was the two-sided 0.05. Primary as well as secondary endpoints were tested, but because the tests of the secondary endpoints are exploratory, no adjustment to p-values was made for multiple comparisons.
analysis.method_desc: The analysis of covariance (ANCOVA) was applied using the treatment groups as a factor and baseline IOP of the study eyes as a covariate.
analysis.estimate_desc: Mean difference was calculated as "mean change from baseline to Week 4 in KP2035 group" minus "mean change from baseline to Week 4 in Xalatan group".

outcome.title: Percent Change of IOP From Baseline to Week 8
outcome.description: Value at Week 8 minus value at baseline was divided by baseline value, then multiplied by 100
outcome.population: The efficacy analysis population was ITT. If there were any missing IOP values at Week 8, the data were supplemented by LOCF using data at Week 4.

group.title: KP2035 Group
group.description: Subjects were treated with KP2035 (0.005% latanoprost + 0.5% timolol combination eye drop) one drop, once daily in the evening (20:00-23:00).

group.title: Xalatan Group
group.description: Subjects were treated with Xalatan (0.005% latanoprost), one drop, once daily in the evening (20:00-23:00).

measure.title: Percent Change of IOP From Baseline to Week 8
measure.description: Value at Week 8 minus value at baseline was divided by baseline value, then multiplied by 100
measure.population: The efficacy analysis population was ITT. If there were any missing IOP values at Week 8, the data were supplemented by LOCF using data at Week 4.

analysis.p_value_desc: The level of statistical significance was the two-sided 0.05. Primary as well as secondary endpoints were tested, but because the tests of the secondary endpoints are exploratory, no adjustment to p-values was made for multiple comparisons.
analysis.method_desc: The analysis of covariance (ANCOVA) was applied using the treatment groups as a factor and baseline IOP of the study eyes as a covariate.
analysis.estimate_desc: Mean difference was calculated as "percent change from baseline to Week 8 in KP2035 group" minus "percent change from baseline to Week 8 in Xalatan group".

outcome.title: Number of Subjects With an IOP of <=15 mmHg at Week 8
outcome.description: Number of subjects who achieved IOP reduction to 15 mmHg or below at Week 8
outcome.population: The efficacy analysis population was ITT. If there were any missing IOP values at Week 8, the data were supplemented by LOCF using data at Week 4.

group.title: KP2035 Group
group.description: Subjects were treated with KP2035 (0.005% latanoprost + 0.5% timolol combination eye drop) one drop, once daily in the evening (20:00-23:00).

group.title: Xalatan Group
group.description: Subjects were treated with Xalatan (0.005% latanoprost), one drop, once daily in the evening (20:00-23:00).

measure.title: Number of Subjects With an IOP of <=15 mmHg at Week 8
measure.description: Number of subjects who achieved IOP reduction to 15 mmHg or below at Week 8
measure.population: The efficacy analysis population was ITT. If there were any missing IOP values at Week 8, the data were supplemented by LOCF using data at Week 4.

analysis.p_value_desc: The level of statistical significance was the two-sided 0.05. Primary as well as secondary endpoints were tested, but because the tests of the secondary endpoints are exploratory, no adjustment to p-values was made for multiple comparisons.
analysis.method_desc: The comparison between the treatment groups was performed by using a logistic regression model which incorporated the baseline IOP.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: Pfizer has the right to review disclosures, requesting a delay of < 60 days. Investigator will postpone single center publications until after disclosure of pooled data (all sites), < 12 months from study completion/termination at all participating sites. Investigator may not disclose previously undisclosed confidential info other than study results.
